paper_abstract: We have performed benchmarks of two three-dimensional parallel Particle-in-Cell (PIC) codes chat are similar but have quite different communication patterns oil different computational Grids. An electrostatic code with only electrons based oil the three-dimensional skeleton PIC code employs the FFT Poisson solver that uses collective communication patterns. Another is the TRISTAN (TRI-dimensional STATNford) code parallelized with MPI, all electromagnetic full particle code, which uses a field solver chat only requires point-to-point neighbor communication patterns. We present the mpptest benchmarks Oil cluster-based computational Grids, where both the basic point-to-point communication patterns and the basic collective communication patterns used in these PIC codes are tested. The results of these benchmarks clearly allow LIS to quantify and understand the scalability of both communication patterns oil the Grids. The present results Show that the parallelized TRISTAN code (without all-to-all collective communication) is more scalable than the parallelized skeleton PIC code (with all-to-all collective communication), in cluster-based computational Grid systems where communication performances is poor. paper_title: Scalability analysis of parallel Particle-In-Cell codes on computational grids
